text: Bottle at The Anchor Tap Tower Bridge. Clear orange gold colour no head. Lovely and cold on a hot day. Some real fruit character on the aroma. Pear juice. Medium sweet. Not much tannin but a little fruit skin maybe. Soft and easy drinking carbonated fruit juice. Ok.
Floral nose, lots of pear flavor. It isnt perfect, but its better than a lot of perrys Ive had.
Apple and pear nose. Clear amber, effervescent. Apple and cherry, sweet and tangy. Light body, moderate carbonation. Sweet but tasty.

Bottle in The Fitzroy Tavern. Clear light golden Amber with a decent white head which dissipates to the ring very quickly. Nose is sweet fruity pear and apple cider, light apple skin tannins, slight floral. On the taste the pear is much more present. Sweet ripe pear, pear and apple skin tannin, floral pear blossom, slight stickiness.

16oz bottle - First off Ill say I dont really drink ciders and such. The pour is a clear light bubbly med gold with virtually no head, just a white ring. The aroma is pear syrup, apple juice, light floral yeast and nectar. Effervescent mouthfeel. Lots of sweet pear and apple upfront with a fruity but drier finish.
Bottle in a Sam Smiths in Beverley. Golden with a frothy white head. Pleasant sweet pear aroma. The taste has clean, crisp pear. Very easy drinking perry but a little processed feeling.

355 ml bottle from Louisville Beer Store; split four ways. Aroma: Pear juice with some residual mulling-type spices; a little honey. Appearance: Transparent pale yellow pour with very soft carbonation holding a ring of bubbly, thin head. Flavor: Semi-sweet pear with honey; fairly spicy thereafter; off-dry at the finish with a quenching, light tartness. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation, long finish. Overall: Quite enjoyable stuff; definitely wanted more than my small sample.

550ml bottle. Pours a golden colour with a short-lived fizzy white foam head. Nose of juicy pear syrup. Taste is sweetish, dessert pears, fruity with a hints of melon, pineapple, peach and a little dry tannin. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine spritzy carbonation, dryish & residual sweet at the finish. Quite drinkable.
Pours a golde from a bottle, big pear-in-syrup aroma, similar flavor. Starts off a little off-dry, but finish ends sweeter. Medium bodied. Nice perry.

Clear, pale golden, no head, bit sparkling. Aroma is of pear with some moderate- fruity tartness and bit vinous. Taste is medium sweet fruity pear juice, pear, moderate- tart, dry finish. Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Superb!
(bottle, Cambridge Wine Merchants, Cambridge)
Aroma is peach/skin and slightly perfumed fruit. The flavor is peaches, fruit and a mild sweet/tart/dry finish.
